panels.title: Total Messages Size On Store Fleet
Total Message Count On Store Fleet

panels.description: Messages in local database per app name, as extracted from the content topic.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT REGEXP_REPLACE(contenttopic,'^\/(.+)\/(\d+)\/(.+)\/(.+)$','\1') as "App name", COUNT(id), pg_column_size(payload)
FROM messages
GROUP BY contenttopic, payload

panels.title: Stored Message by Content Topic App Name

panels.description: Number of messages currently stored in the database
panels.title: Unique stored messages (Postgres)

panels.description: Source: server_version_num
panels.title: PostgreSQL Version

panels.description:
Clients executing Statements.

Source: pg_stat_activity
panels.title: Active clients (Postgres)

panels.description:
Size of all databases in $Instance.

Source: pg_database_size()
panels.title: Total database size (Postgres)

panels.description:
Max Replication lag behind master in seconds

Only available on a standby system.

Source: pg_last_xact_replay_timestamp

Use: pg_stat_replication for Details.
panels.title: Max Replication Lag (Postgres)

panels.description: Source: pg_stat_statements.total_time / pg_stat_statements.calls

panels.description: View: pg_stat_activity
panels.title: Connections by database (stacked) (Postgres)

panels.description:
Transactions committed + roolback per minute

Source: pg_stat_database,xact_commit + xact_rollback
panels.title: Transaction rate (Postgres)

Statements executed per Minute.

Source: pg_stat_statements.calls

panels.description: Source: pg_stat_database

panels.description: 1 Minute rate of transactions committed or rollback.
panels.title: Transactions (Postgres)

panels.description:
Source: pg_stat_database

* tup_fetched: rows needed to satisfy queries
* tup_returned: rows read/scanned
panels.title: Tuples fetched/returned (Postgres)

panels.description:
* blk_read_time: Time spent reading data file blocks by backends in this database, in milliseconds
* blk_write_time: Time spent writing data file blocks by backends in this database, in milliseconds

track_io_timings needs to be activated
panels.title: I/O Read/Write time (Postgres)

panels.description:
Should be 0 

Source: pg_stat_database

With log_lock_waits turned on, deadlocks will be logged to the PostgreSQL Logfiles.
panels.title: Deadlocks by database (Postgres)

panels.description: Source: pg_locks
panels.title: Locks by state (Postgres)

panels.description: Should be 0. If temporary files are created, it can indicate insufficient work_mem. With log_temp_files the creation of temporary files are logged to the PostgreSQL Logfiles.
panels.title: Temporary files by database (Postgres)

panels.description: Number of messages currently stored in the database
panels.title: # messages per shard

panels.description:
Lag behind master in seconds.

Only available on a standby System.
panels.title: Replication lag (Postgres)
